Reviews.Title: “cancelled my booking 1 day before arrival”
Reviews.Author: CHTraveller82
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 nights in this hostel via Hostelworld 3 weeks in advance, received the confirmation and paid the deposit as usual. One day before I was due to arrive I got an email saying that the place was no longer available, leaving me to scramble and find what few places were left in the city. I still haven't got my refund (one email chasing it up has not been enough).

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: finnrobertHelsinki
Reviews.Content: I was treated well here. Good low price and accomodations. The hostel is basic as there is a small looby and kitchen. The rooms are basic bunk beds and a general shower area which could have been cleaner if givien proper attention by the staff. The nice thing for me was in the room were folks from France, Sweden, Columbia all which were happy go lucky and freindly. The rooms had lockers to hold a small suitcase but do bring your own lock. The location is a good one near Central Park and really quite quiet neighborhood. I wouldn't hesitate to go back there for a short stay in the future. Absolutely good room rates and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: Poppy_Mccrale
Reviews.Content: It was a very good trip, we stayed in the 10 bed ensuite. It had air conditioning which was really good for how warm it is in the evening in new york in the summer. The room was clean and tidy and had plenty of room with lockers. The breakfast was good toast and coffee which is a perfect way to start the day, though it strictly goes away at 10 so make sure you get in before then. The staff were friendly and helpful. However when we arrived we had a seperate booking because of availability, they refused to swap our friend even though there was space in our room. It was a case of computer says no. Also they made us check out and check in again despite the fact we were in the same room and beds, which seemed riduclously sticking to the rules. The location was perfect on the upper east side with subway just a block away. Also the restaurant next door the barking dog does really nice food.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: craig_runt
Reviews.Content: The room was warm, bright, smelt of cleaning products (without being overpowering!!), staff were friendly around the clock and was nearby to the subway station. Not luxurious, but we weren't expecting that, and can't comment on the breakfast as we were usually out and about by the time. No signs of the bedbugs that were said to be plaguing the city, so another positive note. Would return here if came back to the city.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly atmosphere that offers the basics in a quiet, convenient neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: tbeaner21
Reviews.Content: This place had the basics. The subway is close and there are restaurants and a convenience store right outside the hostel. It was in a nice quiet spot in Manhattan and a lovely place to come back to after being in 'city'. The staff was helpful and friendly. It was cheap to stay here and they had lockers and a bed. If you're looking for the basics and a comfortable environment, go here!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS!”
Reviews.Author: slm323
Reviews.Content: Unless you enjoy dirty filth, I would NOT recommend staying here. My friend and I (both in our early 30's and from Missouri) stayed here 1 night and we slept fully clothed as we were afraid to even touch anything. Yes, we are from the Midwest where everything is usually clean, nice, and reasonably-priced, but this was truly beyond what we could have even imagined as "slumming it" at a hostel in NYC. Trust me, we aren't "snooty" suburbanites who were mad that it wasn't like the Ritz. This was really really bad. After paying for an "upgrade" to a private room, we still barely slept a wink. Every corner of the place had dirt. The bed and linens were nasty. The TV in room didn't work other a blue-screen. The bathroom was full of mold and filth. The air-conditioner in the window had no caulking, so all the draft came in and we froze. You get 1 sheet and no towels. No blankets. For $100, you'll get a dirty bed and a door to close. That's it really. I would never, ever stay here again unless I was 18 years old and planned to go out and get so sloppy drunk that I didn't care what pile of garbage I put my head on. Avoid. I would, however, recommend The American Dream hostel on 24th. Its very clean and reasonable as hostels go.

Reviews.Title: “nyc hostel”
Reviews.Author: jammmo
Reviews.Content: nice, clean, free breakfast, nice people, reasonable price, nice neighborhood, three blocks to subway

Reviews.Title: “Fun and cheap - what more can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: tehblonde
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Tone on Lex over christmas 2008. The hostel is by no means a luxurious place to stay but I'm pretty sure people looking for luxury don't choose to stay in hostels. This place was a great base for exploring New York, just around the corner from the subway and a fairly short walk from the Metropolitan Museum, Guggenheim and Central Park. We arrived late at night (about 11pm) and before we had even walked through the door we had received an amazingly friendly welcome from some of the staff and other guests, and were invited to go out with them. We had an amazing night out and because the staff knew New York really well we felt really safe. The hostel was a really friendly and fun place to stay, and was really cheap too. We had a room on the ground floor and even though the heating was too high at night time the room was fine. The toilet and shower were small but adequate. The staff were really knowledgeable about the city and gave us advice about the best things to see/do. Breakfast was pretty good - oatmeal/cereal, toast and juice/coffee - and set us up for the day. Overall, I though it was great fun and a good place to stay for young budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “It was like staying in the Arctic”
Reviews.Author: LoveTatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after borrowing a friends appartment for the last nights of our holiday and it ruined it for us. The outside looks gorgeous and really inkeeping with the area but the inside decor was tasteless, the bathrooms were not clean and it was freezing. Considering the day temperatures were about -11 you can imagine what it would be like at night and with a huge sash window that had an inch gap in it and the smallest heater in the room I have ever seen (the radiator had been removed - why?!) needless to say we did not look forward to going to bed. When we asked for and extra blankets (as they only provided two thin fleece ones) they said they had run out. The staff were helpful and found us a larger heater but it did not help. As we only booked in late we had no choice but to stay. We ended up sleeping in our clothes with a dirty duvet tacked over the window to stop the cold air coming in. We complained and the manager said he would refund us half our money. A week and a half later we have still not received this.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun!”
Reviews.Author: stfontes
Reviews.Content: In most aspects the hostel was really good, the staff is really nice and friendly. My only problem was that sometimes the heating was not on during the night and it would get pretty cold. Other than that I had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “I do not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: pze
Reviews.Content: Staff was ignorant, the room I had was tidy and messy, bathroom was a joke ... It was hot in the common rooms. It's rather far from metro station. The only good thing that I can recall is that I stayed for one night and not more ...

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay @ Tone on Lex!”
Reviews.Author: Kill_City
Reviews.Content: I stayed 10 days at the hostel and it's located in The Upper East Side in Manhattan in a calm area and the subway is near, only about 2 mins from the hostel so it's easy to get around from 96st-lexington ave which is the nearest station. A subway ride to midtown takes about 10-15 mins and to downtown 20-25. It's easy to get to Central Park which is about 5-10 mins away, just walk 3 blocks west and you will get there. I came here on a solo trip and it was my first time ever staying at a hostel so I didnt really know what to expect. But to my suprise it was a good hostel and even though check in time doesen't start until 3 pm the staff were very helpful and I was allowed to check in at 2 pm when I arrived. It's a cheap and good hostel. The room: I stayed in a 10 bed dorm mixed with both men and women and it was clean all right, the rooms are have ac so and that was good now in the summer heat of 2009. You get a locker in the room where you can put your personal belongings and fit some clothes, but bring your own lock and key. Most of the rooms don't have their own showers and restrooms but there is one or two on each of the floors. I suggest that if you want to take a shower go to the second floor shower room, that's the best shower. Restrooms ok but some don't have a mirror but the shower rooms have. They serve free breakfast every morning from 9 am and it's usually food there by 10 am if you wanna go up later but to be sure be there between 9-9:30. The food was ok, bagels, fruit, waffles and lemonade so it was ok. One bad thing with the hostel is that there's not really a hang out area but the kitchen and the small garden is where people drink the beer and the vodka and just hang out. Be sure to check out the pubcrawl and the phucked-up fridays when the staff takes you out to party with people from the hostel and this is a great opportunity to get to know some of the people your staying with and it was fun. If you want to check out one of the bars before the pubcrawl go to The Big Easy on 3rd ave and E 92nd st which is a great divebar where you can drink beer and play beerpong with your friends, try it!

HotelInfo.Name: Tone on Lex
HotelInfo.Address: 179 East 94th, New York City, NY 10128
